Module com.augursolutions.wordler
Package com.augursolutions.wordler

Class SimpleDictionary

java.lang.Object
com.augursolutions.wordler.SimpleDictionary
public class SimpleDictionary extends Object
Dictionary implemented as an M-ary tree. Any ASCII character may be stored in the Dictionary with the exception of the `start of text` and `end of text` characters (02 and 03) as these are used to indicate the root node and word endings respectively.

Each node in the tree is one "letter" in one or more words, with the ASCII `start of text` value (02) used for the root node and the `end of text` value (03) used for nodes that indicate the end of a word. The children for each node are stored in a TreeMap so that values are retrieved in alphabetical order (if all values are alpha-numeric). Actual ordering is based on the ASCII integer value of each char.

As an example, consider a Dictionary object with the words "AT", "BE", "BED", and "BEST". The associated tree would look like the image below, with (R) indicating the root node and (E) indicating nodes that mark the end of a word. 

     A-T-(E)
    /
 (R) 
    \
     B   (E)
      \ / 
       E-D-(E)  
        \
         S-T-(E)
Author:
Steven Major

      public boolean addWord(String word)
      Add a word to the dictionary
      Parameters:
      word - Word to add
      Returns:
      true If the word is added successfully (false if it already exists or if word is null or empty)

    • removeWord

      public void removeWord(String word)
      Remove a word from the Dictionary; the Dictionary object is modified in the process. If word is not present in the dictionary, it is left unmodified
      Parameters:
      word - Word to be removed from the Dictionary
